name: textured
content:
textured adjective
(SURFACE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
having a surface that is not smooth but has a raised pattern: The hallway has textured wallpaper. She uses a lot of textured fabrics such as tweed and corduroy. The textured surface of the handle makes it easier to grip.

textured adjective
(HAIR)
(of hair) curly or slightly curly rather than straight: Textured hair can be more time-consuming to take care of than straight hair.
(of hair) cut or styled (= arranged) so that it has shape and does not lie flat: Ask your hairdresser to add some textured layers for body and fullness. Drying the hair roughly can give it a more textured and modern look.

textured adjective
(PAINT)
(of paint) containing something such as sand so that the surface it is used on is not completely smooth: The outside walls are painted with a textured masonry paint. The textured coating should last for 10 years or more.
textured adjective
(FOOD)
(of food) containing thick or hard parts rather than being completely smooth: Blend the ingredients until they are well combined but still a little textured. Granita is granular and textured, and much less smooth than sorbet.
(of food or drink) having an interesting taste because of containing several different flavours at the same time: This is a delicious textured wine. Nothing beats the richly textured flavours of this dish.
